Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Well...how do you feel?

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: Ask me in about five minutes.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I'm talking about graduation. Being totally free to do whatever we want now.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: It feels excellent.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Gotta throw the anchor over.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: C'mon, Jimmy. Something's bothering you.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: It's just that we're right around that old summer camp where all those murders took place.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: What murders?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Never mind, you don't want to know about it.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: Tell me.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: There's nothing to worry about, Suzy. The guy's dead now, somewhere at the bottom of this lake...if you believe the stories.  Let's drop it, okay?

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: What stories?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: There was this boy named Jason Voorhees who drowned in Crystal Lake...

Speaker: young jason
Dialogue: Hhhhelp....me....I'm drowning...

Speaker: young jason
Dialogue: Mmmmmmommy....

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: A bunch of years went by and everybody forgot about it.  That's when the murders started.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: Jason did it...?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: His mother blamed the counselors for his death and tried to kill them all.  She got her head chopped off by one of them.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: So the murders stopped?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Legend has it that Jason came back to avenge his mother's death, vowing to kill every teenager from the area.  And every now and then, the murders start up again.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Forget about it, Suzy. They're just stories.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: We're the last graduating class, right?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: I mean, Lakeview High just closed its doors for good, right?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: So there's no reason for him to come back because there won't be any of us around...right?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Right. Except that Jason isn't real so none of it matters anyway.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: Did you hear that?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Hear what?

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: C'mon, I'm serious.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: All right, I'll check it out.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: Jimmy...?

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: Jim...?

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: Stop screwing around, Jim. I mean it...

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Gotcha good, baby cakes.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: All right, all right -- I'm a major ass.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: And you'll never do it again.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: And I'll never do it again. Forgive me?

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: suzy
Dialogue: JJJJJJJJason...

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Uh-huh. You must really think I'm an ass.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Ohmygod...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Remember girls, the shuffleboard tournament will start at six p.m. sharp. A non-attendance will restrict your time in port, understood?

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: You're telling me this boat has a pool with a three meter board?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: It's a ship and that's right. Plus a disco, gym, game room and a lot more.

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: I think I'm gonna blow off New York and just stay on this thing.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You'll do no such thing, Mr. Wolfe...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Your itinerary has been carefully planned and make no mistake, it will be executed accordingly.

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: Of course...wouldn't want to risk enjoying this trip.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Which cabin is Rennie in, Mr. McCulloch?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Rennie's not coming.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: But I thought...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: She changed her mind.  Let's see...Mr. Wolfe is in stateroom one-eleven and you, Mr. Robertson, are in two-twenty-five.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Be right up, Dad.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Me too. But I'm not sure Uncle Charles will be.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: What about not-so-great writers?

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Just felt a little chill.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: That's wonderful, Miss Van Deusen...what's it about?

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I don't know what to say...

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Hi, Mrs. Watanabe. Just kidding.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: Don't worry about a thing, Mom. I'll have a terrific time and I won't do anything stupid, okay?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: I hear the crew members are cute guys in their twenties.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: I'm sure we'll have no problem getting them to party with us...especially with this.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: It's my graduation gift from Daddy. It cost over a thousand bucks but it's the best.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: He bought you that?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: More or less. It's part of my college fund.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You can stop right there, Miss Mason.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: mccullocb
Dialogue: You never turned in your final biology project, so I've had your diploma rescinded.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: You can't do that...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: It's already been done.  Congratulations on the 3.9 average, Miss Watanabe. You're in stateroom two- fifty-five.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Look, Mr. McCulloch, I got in a car accident yesterday and missed our appointment. It's okay, no big deal, just a bruised arm...  ...so I brought my project along today. It's in my suitcase. Really.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: She's telling the truth, Mr. McCulloch. I saw her pack it.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: All right. But if it mysteriously disappears en route, I'll have you sent back home the minute we dock. Understood?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Perfectly.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Improvise, of course.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Jim Miller and Suzy Donaldson never showed up. I'm a little concerned.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Let's go -- we're running two minutes late.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You have no right...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: She doesn't know what she wants. She's never had a stable life.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: I'm her legal guardian, not you or anybody else, and I alone know what's best for her. End of discussion.

Speaker: young jason
Dialogue: Hhhhelp me....I'm drowning...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I just got a little dizzy. I'm fine.

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: Let's take in the brow.

Speaker: chief engineer
Dialogue: Yes Sir.  Take in the gangway and single up all lines.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Hello, Dad.

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: Hey, Admiral Robertson. Love your ship.

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: She's a beauty, isn't she? I should've retired from the Navy ten years ago.

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: You've really been generous to give us this cruise. I know I speak for everybody on board.

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: Hell, there's just twenty or so of you -- we only need a skeleton crew and it's a pleasure to sail her anyway.  By the way, congratulations on winning the intramural diving championships, Miles. I'm sure you made your old man proud.

Speaker: chief engineer
Dialogue: Have you decided on your departure protocol, Admiral?

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: Actually, I thought I'd leave the honors to my son.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Dad, I don't think...

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: Relinquishing command of the Princess Ruby to Captain Sean Robertson.

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: But before you take the helm, take this.

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: Something old and something new. I used the sextant when I was your age, but now they have these goddamn computers to do all the work for you.

Speaker: chief engineer
Dialogue: Have you decided on a plan of departure, Captain?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: How about if we start up the forward engines and come around. 180 degrees...

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: Aren't you forgetting something?

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: We're in foggy weather! Send out the international maritime signal that a vessel is backing down, followed by a security broadcast warning other ships!

Speaker: deck hand
Dialogue: This voyage is doomed.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Yeah, tell me about it.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Rennie...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Hi, Sean.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I heard you weren't coming.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: We changed our minds.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I got you a present.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: But I didn't get you one...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Forget it. It's a dumb little thing anyway.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Sean...it's beautiful.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I thought maybe we could hike to the top of the Statue when we got there, if you felt like it. It's supposed to be 22 stories tall.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I'd love to.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I guess I'll see you later.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: There's a storm predicted tonight.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You're making a big mistake, Rennie. It's not too late to put you back on land.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I'm staying.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: If Miss Van Deusen knew how afraid you were of...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: She didn't push me into coming.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Why are you doing this to yourself?

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I don't even know why I'm afraid, Uncle Charles. I can't even remember when it started. Don't you think it's time I found out and got over it?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Facing your fear doesn't always conquer it.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I'm staying.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: Too cool, J.J. Your parents came through.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: Sure...but I gotta shoot some shockumentary footage first.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: She's sexy.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: I'll catch you later.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: What do you think...time for some personal experiences to fuel our minds?

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I agree.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Okay Toby, calm down...

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: I'm not sure we're supposed to be here, Tamara.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Is that a muscular bod or what?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: He's undefeated, you know that?  Julius is the only senior I'd even consider doing it with. If he wasn't black, that is.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: My parents are open minded about that sort of thing.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: My stepmom couldn't care less, but Daddy would have a shit fit.  He might even pay some attention to me.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Gorgeous guy at ten o'clock. Look sensual.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: I think it's time for some recreational activity, girl.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: Sounds good. I hear there's a shuffleboard court on deck -- it might be kinds cool...

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: You're joking, right?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Have you seen my niece anywhere?

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: Yeah, motivating downstairs, I think. What's the problem, Mr. McCulloch?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Senior predictions started five minutes ago and she hasn't shown up.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: Some of us don't want our futures predicted.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: In your case I'm sure that's true.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: The night time is the right time.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: No thanks.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: What? Don't be a lightweight...this is top dollar toot.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: It's not that, it's just that...  It I get caught, I'll lose my science scholarship and everything.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: You're talking to the prom queen, Eva. Do you really think I'm going to risk getting caught?

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: I guess not.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Do you realize how many people would kill to be sitting here right now? Come on, it's grad night. You've got your whole life to be uptight.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Is that unbelievable or what?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Jesus, you scared the hell out of us.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: No, we haven't.  Care for a hit?

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: No thanks.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: A real space cadet. I wonder if she'll narc on us...

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: I have her in Creative Writing and she's fairly nice.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Nobody related to McCulloch can be nice.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Toby?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Oh yeah. Ready to party and then some.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: What are you doing in here?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Are you girls using drugs?

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: Do you think I would use drugs, Mr. McCulloch? We were just exploring the ship.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: I'11 be coming around your stateroom in exactly fifteen minutes, Miss Mason. You'd better have your biology project ready or I'm phoning your parents.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: They're out of town.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Then I'll make sure you remain on board while your classmates see the sights.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Relax, I've got McCulloch covered... but that little narcing bitch niece of his is a different matter.  Rumor has it she's a teensy bit afraid of the water...

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: A half-twist short. I'll hone that dive yet.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Have you seen my dog anywhere?

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Yeah...a lot.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: There's something I haven't told you...

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Wow, sorry...

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: It was an accident, I swear...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: What happened?  Rennie, are you okay?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: That was truly excellent.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Time to check out the waiters.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: I think I'll pass. See you later, okay?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: But...wait a minute!

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Some friend you are.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I can't swim.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: It's not that simple.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Whenever I get near the water, I see this young boy drowning. He tries to pull me down with him.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: About four years ago...at Crystal Lake. I spent a few summers there with Uncle Charles inbetween boarding school.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: No. It was just a normal summer. I've never been able to figure it out.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Oh, I can see that. You've done a wonderful job of supervising the kids, Miss Van Deusen.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: It wasn't her fault.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Stay away from her...both of you.

Speaker: deck hand
Dialogue: He's come back and you're all going to die.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Just...leave me alone...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: I'm in no mood for any more stall tactics, Miss Mason. Where is your final project?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Wouldn't you like a glass of champagne first, Charles?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Where did you get that alcohol?

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: I packed it. Just for us.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: That's it. You're not setting foot off this ship until we return home.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: But I haven't even shown you my biology project...

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Take a closer look, Charles. I want to make sure I labeled all my organs correctly.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Oh, you've done it now. Not only are you going home, I'll see to it that you spend next year back in a high school classroom!

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: I don't think so, Mr. McCulloch.  Did you get anything good?

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: Oh yeah.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You'll never get away with it.  You're both going to be very, very sorry.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Relax, Wayne. He won't risk doing a thing.  Can I have the tape?

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: This is going to sound supremely lame...but I've had the major hots for you since our sophomore year, Tamara.

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: That's sweet, Wayne. Look, I'd love to chat but I'm really pressed for time.  Let's try to get together later, okey- doke?

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: But I thought...

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Thanks for the camerawork.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: Wayne, you're an asshole.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: It's not real, it's not real...

Speaker: tamara
Dialogue: Please...please don't...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: It's okay...you're going to be okay.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I want to go home. I want off this ship.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Me too.  Let's go talk to my Dad.

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: Let's kick in the stablilizers, Mr. Carlson, and get the seas off the quarter. These kids are in for one hell of a storm.

Speaker: chief engineer
Dialogue: Yes Sir. Activating comfort cruise mode.

Speaker: chief engineer
Dialogue: Nineteen months.

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: A tremendous age. Take some advice from a salty old man: don't push him too hard.

Speaker: chief engineer
Dialogue: This is the bridge. Approaching weather suggests we secure the main deck and...

Speaker: admiral robertson
Dialogue: Better have them doublecheck the lifeboat stations as well...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Can he really take us home?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Not completing a voyage is against everything he stands for. But I think I can convince him to call a Coast Guard cutter for you.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: What about you?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: If I go with you, he'll never speak to me again.  But I'm never going to live up to his expectations anyway...so maybe it's the right thing to do.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Oh Jesus...Dad??

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: He's...he's dead...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: I thought I told you to stay away from her.

Speaker: mccullocb
Dialogue: That's a very good question and I'd appreciate an answer.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: Miles -- have you seen J.J.? She was supposed to be jamming down in the power room but...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: What is happening???

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I don't know...we've gone off course or something...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: What do you mean???

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I don't know what I mean! All's I know is that there's no one guiding this ship anymore...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Can't you call for help??

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I think so. But we have to lower the anchors so we don't drift any further...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Where are they?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: The bow...front of the ship. There's a hoist on each side that lowers them

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I didn't mean for you to go!

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Just radio for help, okay???

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Mayday, mayday, mayday...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Please...can anybody out there hear me??

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: Sean, what's going on?

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: Jesus Christ...

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: Who did this, man?

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: Is the radio even working??

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: Isn't there some international S.O.S. thing you can do???

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Mayday, mayday, mayday...this is the Princess Ruby. Please, somebody answer...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: The Captain and Chief Engineer... they've been...they're dead.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I...I don't know...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I've got the numbers.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Hello? Are you there??

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: I demand to know what is going on...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Where's the radio?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: It's...dead.

Speaker: deck hand
Dialogue: You're the last ones. He's come back for you.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: deck hand
Dialogue: Jason Voorhees.

Speaker: deck hand
Dialogue: He walks this ship, here and now.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: A killer walks this ship indeed. And it's certainly none of us...

Speaker: deck hand
Dialogue: You're the one who's insane!!

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: That lunatic has been spouting off about Jason since we boarded...  It's no coincidence.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Walking corpses are not real!

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: Yeah, well these dead bodies are sure enough real.  I say we regroup and find this motherfucker before he finds us.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You'll do no.such thing and watch your mouth, young man! I'm in charge here!

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: School's out, McCulloch.  Let's go.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Christ...where's Rennie??

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: She's...she's dropping the anchors. I thought the Coast Guard could find us easier if...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: What?? You sent her out there with a murderer running around loose??

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: What's going on? I heard on the P.A. system that...

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: The Captain's been murdered. The buzz is that Jason might be on board.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: Jason...Voorhees?

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: Have you seen Tamara?

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: No. And I'm not losing any sleep over it.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: But she might be in trouble...

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: So what else is new?  Look Eva, you're asking the wrong dude to feel sorry for Tamara Mason. Wise up -- it's not hip to be her friend.

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: I don't care about being hip anymore.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but I've gotta find J.J.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Toby?

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: Tamara?

Speaker: eva
Dialogue: Tamara?  I just want to talk with you.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Toby? Where'd you go?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You had me worried to death!

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: But Sean said...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: I'm the one you should be listening to! Do you think dropping an anchor in the middle of a storm makes any sense whatsoever?

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: I managed to scrounge this shit from the game room and hallways. Grab what you want.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: What are you taking, Julius?

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: Nothin'.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: We're talking the possibility of Jason Voorhees here.

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: Nothin' but this gun.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Can't we at least talk about it?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: I refuse to discuss this ridiculous notion that a ghoul is terrorizing this ship.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: But what about the drowning boy I've been seeing?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Whatever you've been...imagining... has nothing to do with Jason Voorhees.  I want you to be safe, Rennie. That's all I care about.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I'm not staying in my room, Uncle Charles.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: This isn't a request.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: J.J. -- you down here?

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: We got a major problem, Wayne.

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: wayne
Dialogue: No no no...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: We could hit a reef, collide with another ship...we could be out here for weeks before anybody spotted us.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: She's locked safe in her room, no thanks to either of you.  Has he brought it back on course yet?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: He's the son of the Captain, for Chrissakes. You'd think he'd be able to operate this thing!

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Well?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: It worked...we're back on course!

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: The fire alarm...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Can you shut that damn thing off??

Speaker: mcculiach
Dialogue: There's only one person who needs to see it. And I'm going to find him.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: I doubt very much that one even exists.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Use some common sense! Setting off a fire alarm causes panic...the same kind of panic caused by suggesting Jason Voorhees is on board.  Enough is enough.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: We have to get everybody together just in case the fire's for real.

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: I'll take the upper deck.

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: Miles??

Speaker: young jason
Dialogue: Hhhhelp me....I'm drowning...

Speaker: young rennie
Dialogue: Hhhhelp....me....

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Rennie...??

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: The window...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I don't understand what is happening to me...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: It's gonna be okay...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: What is it??

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Rule one, don't panic. Rule two, assess the damage and act accordingly...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Is the ship going to sink??

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: The emergency lights just kicked in...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: We'll be okay. I want you to wait by the lifeboats, just in case.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I'm not going near any lifeboat!

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: But Rennie...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I'm not!!

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Rennie??

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Come on, answer!!

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Water has gotten to the engines.  We have to get everybody off this ship...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: What did you do with Rennie??

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: She never should've set foot on this ship. This is your fault!

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: This is Jason's fault!

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Not another word, do you hear me??

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Why aren't you with the others, woman??

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Jason Voorhees is dead!!

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Dear Christ...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: We have to get off this ship!!

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Everybody in -- I'll get the hoists

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Get in the boat, Rennie!

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I...I can't...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You can and you will!!

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Stop it!!

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Toby...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Come on...faster....

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Start rowing!!

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: He's gone...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: It's Julius!

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: If we don't find the shore soon we're all going to die.

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: Hey man, if I can make it, so can. you.

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: Hey man, wake up! Check it out!!

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: God damn, we're in New York! You did it, my man!!

Speaker: young rennie
Dialogue: Hhhhelp...me....

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: No!!!

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Come on -- everybody up the ladder.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: A wonderful choice of places to dock a boat, Mr. Robertson.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: We can't let those gang-bangers get away, man...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You heard him! We have to call the police

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Everyone split up -- we'll cover more ground that way.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: My niece's life hangs in the balance right now!! Every second counts.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Please don't...

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: C'mon...

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: Get me the police -- this is an emergency...

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: Use the combos and keep the feet light...

Speaker: julius
Dialogue: Take your best shot, motherfucker...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Rennie...what'd they do to you??

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Drugs...  Then Jason came. He's here, Sean.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: We have to find the others.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Freeze.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: It's okay -- she's with me.

Speaker: irish cop
Dialogue: My apologies, Miss. My unit's right over here.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Rennie, thank God...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Jason's here in New York.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Don't be ridiculous!

Speaker: irish cop
Dialogue: Is this the lass in question?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: irish cop
Dialogue: Who is...Jason?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: He's a walking corpse, a phantasm from hell.

Speaker: irish cop
Dialogue: So try me.

Speaker: irish cop
Dialogue: You're right -- I find it a tall tale indeed. But you seem like honest folks so I'm inclined to believe at least some of it.

Speaker: irish cop
Dialogue: I'm sure he'll pop up soon enough. Why don't you climb in the back while I radio for backup.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: There aren't any handles!!

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Rennie, for God's sake slow down!!

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Miss Van Deusen...

Speaker: young rennie
Dialogue: What a beautiful day.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Perfect for a swim, isn't it?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You've been coming out here every summer for the last three years, young lady, and you still haven't learned how.

Speaker: young rennie
Dialogue: I'll take some lessons this time. I promise.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: That's what you said last year. I think the time for your first swimming lesson has just come.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You don't want to end up drowning like that Voorhees boy, do you?

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: He never learned how either and he's still at the bottom of this lake.

Speaker: young rennie
Dialogue: He is not.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Oh, he is indeed. And ready to pull down anybody who falls in and can't swim.

Speaker: young rennie
Dialogue: You're telling a lie.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Am I? Let's find out.

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: Better swim before Jason drags you down, Rennie. Come on, you can do it...

Speaker: young rennie
Dialogue: I...I can't...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You can and you will! Swim, Rennie!

Speaker: young rennie
Dialogue: Hhhhelp...me....

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: You pushed me...

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: I was only trying to teach you. But I pulled you out, Rennie. I saved your life.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: You son of a bitch...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: He was down there!!!

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: You keep away from her!

Speaker: mcculloch
Dialogue: You...are...NOT POSSIBLE.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: I was at school when they told me. 'Rennie, we have some very bad news... your parents have been killed in an auto accident.'

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: It seems like everybody I care about ends up...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Not this time.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Toby...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: What's wrong, boy?

Speaker: ticket taker
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Come on...

Speaker: train engineer
Dialogue: Hey pal, you can't do that...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: NO!!!

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: It's over, Rennie. It's finally over.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: God...please no...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Somebody help us!! He's going to kill us!!!

Speaker: street urchin
Dialogue: You're dead meat, slime bag.

Speaker: street urchin
Dialogue: Hey man, it's cool, it's cool...

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: You have to call the police...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Please, hurry...

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: There's a pay phone in back.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: ...but it's broken.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: You don't understand -- there's a maniac trying to kill us!!!

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Welcome to New York.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Look!

Speaker: sanitation engineer
Dialogue: What the hell are you kids doing down here?

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Can you help us get out??

Speaker: sanitation engineer
Dialogue: I sure can and we don't have a minute to waste.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: sanitation engineer
Dialogue: Toxic waste, son. This sewer floods out with the stuff on the 13th of every month, right at midnight.  And that's less than ten minutes from now.

Speaker: sanitation engineer
Dialogue: Follow me.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Run, Rennie...

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: You never got me in the lake, Jason. And you're not going to get me now either.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Get up, Sean!!!

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Climb!!!

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Mmmmmmmmmommy...DON'T LET ME DROWN, MOMMY...

Speaker: young jason
Dialogue: Hhhhelp me....

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I hear there's a statue here that's 22 stories tall.

Speaker: rennie
Dialogue: Oh Toby...
